name: Dinner Tonight: Stuffed Tomato Nests
description: The hardest part about the stuffed vegetable recipes that I've tried is that whatever I happen to mix together--no matter how thoughtful the combination--has to come to together perfectly at the same time. Which, as I've found out the hard...

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Cut a hole around the stem. Scoop out the insides with a spoon, leaving enough to keep the walls fairly strong. Sprinkle a little salt inside, and turn upside down to drain off any excess liquid.
Place on a baking sheet lined with aluminum and coated with a little oil and set in the oven for five minutes. When done, drain the juices from the inside, again.
Crack the egg inside the tomato cavity. Stick the butter on top of the egg. Set back in the oven and cook 5-8 minutes, or until the whites have set. Season with salt and pepper.
